ai.summary: Hanna's Close - Green Lane Walk is a 7.3 km moderate hike in the UK that follows a traditional green lane. The route offers grassy, tree-lined scenery with sections that may be muddy after rain and occasional gates or stiles to negotiate. Suitable for walkers with moderate fitness and a sense of adventure, the walk is accessible year-round with appropriate footwear and preparation.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain is typical of a UK green lane: predominantly grassy or compact earth underfoot, with uneven spots and potential mud in wet weather. Expect gates, stiles, and occasional hedgerows; some stretches may be narrow or bordered by low walls or hedges, and visibility can vary in overgrown sections.
ai.safety_notes: Plan according to daylight and weather. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers, as conditions can change quickly on exposed lanes. Stay on the public right of way, be prepared for gates and stiles, and watch for livestock. Check the forecast, carry a map or GPS, and have a charged phone; let someone know your route and expected return time. In wet conditions, walk carefully to avoid slipping, and be mindful of farm traffic or vehicles on wider lanes. Keep dogs on a lead where required.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline maps and emergency contacts
Headlamp or flashlight (for low light circumstances)
Walking poles (optional, for stability on uneven ground)
Waterproof jacket or shell and hat
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are usually the best seasons for this 7.3 km green lane walk in the UK, offering drier conditions and longer daylight. Winter can be muddy and dark, so plan accordingly and check daylight hours and weather before setting out.
